citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
At the time of inspection 2 chinchillas, “Ponyboy” and “Johnny,” are missing patches of fur in various areas along their
bodies. The facility noticed the coat changes of these chinchillas approximately 3 weeks ago. The Attending Veterinarian
had not been contacted as of the date of this inspection, 2/12/2024. Undiagnosed and untreated medical conditions may
lead to pain, discomfort, or worsening illness in animals.
At the time of inspection 2 guinea pigs, “Flora” and “Poppy,” have overgrown nails. Overgrown nails may cause lameness
which may lead to pain, discomfort, or long-term changes to the associated limbs.
Facilities must establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that include the use of appropriate methods
to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The facility must communicate with the attending
veterinarian to evaluate these animals and determine an appropriate plan for diagnosis, treatment, and maintenance.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by April 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
